accessibilite.name: Accessibility
accessibilite.description: Make the site accessible to everyone

details.noDetails: No details available for this item

titleTag.label: <title> tag present and optimized
titleTag.description: Unique and relevant title with keywords
titleTag.explication: The title tag is one of the most important elements for SEO. It appears in the browser tab and in search results. It must be unique for each page and contain the main keywords naturally.

commentFaire.item1: Right-click on your page -> 'View page source' -> Look for the <title> tag
commentFaire.item2: Use Chrome extension 'SEO Meta in 1 Click' to analyze your titles
commentFaire.item3: Test with Google Search Console tool to see appearance in SERPs
commentFaire.item4: Check length with online tool 'Title Tag Length Checker'

bonnesPratiques.item1: Length between 50 and 60 characters (visible in SERPs)
bonnesPratiques.item2: Include main keyword at the beginning of the title
bonnesPratiques.item3: Unique for each page of the site
bonnesPratiques.item4: Descriptive and attractive to encourage clicks
bonnesPratiques.item5: Include brand name at the end

metaDescription.label: <meta name="description"> tag filled
metaDescription.explication: The meta description appears in search results under the title. It must be descriptive, attractive and contain the main keywords to encourage clicks.

commentFaire.item1: Inspect your page (F12) -> Look for <meta name="description"> tag
commentFaire.item2: Use Google Search Console tool to see appearance in SERPs
commentFaire.item3: Test with 'SEO Meta in 1 Click' extension
commentFaire.item4: Check length with 'Meta Description Length Checker'

bonnesPratiques.item1: Length between 150 and 160 characters (visible in SERPs)
bonnesPratiques.item3: Unique for each page of the site
bonnesPratiques.item4: Descriptive and attractive to encourage clicks
bonnesPratiques.item5: Avoid special characters that can be truncated

singleH1.label: Single <h1> tag per page
singleH1.explication: Each page should have a single H1 tag that represents the main title of the page. This helps search engines understand the content hierarchy.

commentFaire.item3: Check that there is only one

headingsStructure.label: Logical heading structure (H1 > H2 > H3)
headingsStructure.explication: A clear heading structure helps search engines understand content and improves accessibility.

commentFaire.item1: Check that there is only one H1 per page
commentFaire.item2: Use headings in logical order (H1 > H2 > H3)

cleanUrls.label: Readable and short URL
cleanUrls.explication: Clean and descriptive URLs improve SEO and user experience. They should be short, readable and contain relevant keywords.

altText.label: Alt text on all images
altText.explication: Alt text allows screen readers to describe images to visually impaired users and improves image SEO.

commentFaire.item2: Check that each image has an alt attribute

internalLinks.label: Internal links present
internalLinks.explication: Internal links help distribute PageRank and improve navigation. They should be relevant and use descriptive anchors.

canonical.label: Canonical tag present
canonical.explication: The canonical tag tells search engines which is the main version of a page. It avoids duplicate content issues and improves SEO.

commentFaire.item1: Inspect your page (F12) -> Look for <link rel="canonical">
commentFaire.item2: Check that canonical URL points to correct page
commentFaire.item3: Use Google Search Console tool to detect errors
commentFaire.item4: Test with 'SEO Meta in 1 Click' extension

bonnesPratiques.item3: Canonical URL different from current URL if needed

sitemapXml.label: XML sitemap present and valid
sitemapXml.description: Helps search engines discover your pages
sitemapXml.explication: The XML sitemap lists all URLs of your site to facilitate indexing by search engines.

robotsTxt.label: robots.txt file configured
robotsTxt.explication: The robots.txt file tells search engines which pages can be indexed.

schemaOrg.label: Structured data (Schema.org)
schemaOrg.explication: Structured data helps search engines understand your site content and can improve display in search results.

commentFaire.item3: Test with Google Rich Results Test

breadcrumbs.label: Breadcrumbs present
breadcrumbs.explication: Breadcrumbs improve user navigation and can improve local SEO by showing site structure.

altText.label: Alt text present on images
altText.explication: Alt text allows screen readers to describe images to visually impaired users. It must be descriptive and relevant to understand the image content.

commentFaire.item1: Inspect your images with F12 -> Look for alt attribute
commentFaire.item2: Use Chrome extension 'Web Developer' to check alt texts
commentFaire.item3: Test with a screen reader like NVDA or JAWS
commentFaire.item4: Check with online tool 'WAVE Web Accessibility Evaluator'

bonnesPratiques.item1: Descriptive and informative to understand the image
bonnesPratiques.item4: Include context if image is part of a link
bonnesPratiques.item5: Appropriate length (not too short, not too long)

contrastRatio.label: Sufficient contrast ratios (WCAG AA minimum)
contrastRatio.description: Readable text on dark or light background
contrastRatio.explication: Contrast ratio measures the brightness difference between text and background. A 4.5:1 minimum ratio ensures readability for visually impaired users.

commentFaire.item2: Test with Chrome extension 'Color Contrast Analyzer'
commentFaire.item3: Check with 'WAVE Web Accessibility Evaluator' tool
commentFaire.item4: Use 'axe DevTools' extension for automatic analysis

bonnesPratiques.item3: Avoid red/green combinations for colorblind users
bonnesPratiques.item4: Test with different types of colorblindness

semanticHtml.label: Semantic HTML used
semanticHtml.explication: Semantic HTML uses the right tags to describe content (header, nav, main, article, section, footer). This improves accessibility and SEO.

commentFaire.item1: Inspect your source code with F12
commentFaire.item2: Check for presence of header, nav, main, footer
commentFaire.item4: Test with 'WAVE Web Accessibility Evaluator' tool

keyboardNavigation.label: Functional keyboard navigation
keyboardNavigation.explication: Keyboard navigation is essential for users who cannot use a mouse. All interactive elements must be accessible via Tab, Enter and Space.

commentFaire.item1: Test with Tab to navigate between elements
commentFaire.item2: Check that all links and buttons are focusable
commentFaire.item3: Test with Enter and Space to activate

focusIndicators.label: Visible focus indicators
focusIndicators.description: Clear visual feedback for keyboard navigation
focusIndicators.explication: Focus indicators allow users to know which element is currently selected during keyboard navigation.

commentFaire.item1: Test with Tab to see indicators
commentFaire.item2: Check that focus is visible on all elements
commentFaire.item3: Use outline or border for focus

formLabels.label: Explicit labels for form fields
formLabels.explication: Form labels help users understand what is expected in each field. They are essential for accessibility and user experience.

commentFaire.item1: Check that each field has a label
commentFaire.item2: Use for attribute to associate label and input

ariaAttributes.label: Appropriate ARIA attributes
ariaAttributes.description: Roles, labels and states for complex elements
ariaAttributes.explication: ARIA (Accessible Rich Internet Applications) attributes help make complex elements accessible to assistive technologies.

skipLinks.label: Skip links present
skipLinks.description: Links to skip navigation and go to content
skipLinks.explication: Skip links allow keyboard users to jump directly to main content, improving navigation experience.

commentFaire.item1: Add skip links at the beginning of the page
commentFaire.item2: Place them first in tab order

errorMessages.label: Accessible error messages
errorMessages.explication: Error messages must be clear, informative and accessible to assistive technologies to help all users correct their errors.

commentFaire.item1: Test messages with a screen reader

colorBlindness.label: Test with different types of colorblindness
colorBlindness.explication: Colorblind users have difficulty distinguishing certain colors. It is important not to use color alone to convey information.

commentFaire.item3: Check that information doesn't depend only on color

bonnesPratiques.item5: Test with different types of colorblindness

reducedMotion.label: Respect reduced motion preferences
reducedMotion.explication: Some users are sensitive to animations and movements. It is important to respect their preferences to avoid health issues.

screenReader.label: Test with a screen reader
screenReader.description: Check experience with NVDA, JAWS, VoiceOver
screenReader.explication: Screen readers are assistive technologies used by visually impaired people. Testing with these tools ensures accessibility.

fontSize.label: Sufficient font size
fontSize.explication: A sufficient font size improves readability for all users, especially for visually impaired people.

commentFaire.item1: Check font size in developer tools

lazyLoading.label: Lazy loading images
lazyLoading.explication: Lazy loading allows images to load only when needed, improving page loading performance.

bonnesPratiques.item3: Avoid lazy loading for above the fold images

imageOptimization.label: Optimized image size
imageOptimization.explication: Image optimization reduces loading time and improves performance. Use modern formats like WebP and appropriate compression.

commentFaire.item1: Use online tools like TinyPNG or Squoosh
commentFaire.item2: Convert to WebP format for better compression

modernFormats.label: Use of modern formats (WebP, AVIF)
modernFormats.explication: Modern formats like WebP and AVIF offer better compression than JPEG and PNG, reducing file size and improving performance.

commentFaire.item2: Use tools like Squoosh or ImageOptim

minification.label: CSS and JS minified
minification.explication: Minification removes spaces, comments and unnecessary characters from CSS and JavaScript files to reduce their size.

commentFaire.item1: Use tools like UglifyJS for JavaScript
commentFaire.item2: Use tools like CSSNano for CSS
commentFaire.item3: Configure your build process to minify automatically

bonnesPratiques.item1: Minify all CSS and JS files

gzipCompression.label: GZIP compression enabled
gzipCompression.explication: GZIP compression significantly reduces the size of transmitted files, improving loading times and reducing bandwidth usage.

bonnesPratiques.item1: Enable GZIP for all text files

browserCache.label: Browser cache configured
browserCache.explication: Browser cache allows browsers to store static resources locally, reducing server requests and improving performance.

criticalCss.label: Critical CSS inlined
criticalCss.explication: Critical CSS is the CSS needed for initial page rendering. Inlining this CSS improves performance by avoiding blocking requests.

reducedRequests.label: Reduced number of requests
reducedRequests.explication: Reducing the number of HTTP requests improves performance and reduces environmental impact by decreasing energy consumption.

pageWeight.label: Page weight under 1 MB
pageWeight.explication: A reduced page weight improves performance and reduces environmental impact by decreasing energy and bandwidth consumption.

noUnnecessaryTracking.label: No unnecessary tracking
noUnnecessaryTracking.explication: Third-party tracking scripts can slow down the site and consume unnecessary resources. It's important to only use those that are really necessary.

systemFonts.label: Use of system fonts or local hosting
systemFonts.explication: Using system fonts or hosting fonts locally reduces external requests and improves performance.

responsiveDesign.label: Responsive design (mobile → desktop)
responsiveDesign.description: Optimized display for all screen sizes
responsiveDesign.explication: Responsive design allows your site to automatically adapt to all screen sizes, providing an optimal user experience on all devices.

touchTargets.label: Appropriate button size (min. 44 px)
touchTargets.explication: Touch targets must be large enough to be easily usable on touch devices.

commentFaire.item2: Use min-width and min-height in CSS

noHorizontalScroll.label: No overflowing elements / horizontal scroll
noHorizontalScroll.explication: Horizontal scrolling on mobile is a poor user experience. All elements must adapt to screen width.

perceivedSpeed.label: Fast perceived loading speed
perceivedSpeed.explication: Perceived speed is more important than actual speed. Use techniques like skeletons and smooth transitions to improve experience.

https.label: Site in HTTPS
https.explication: HTTPS encrypts data exchanged between browser and server, protecting user privacy.

contentSecurityPolicy.label: Content Security Policy (CSP) configured
contentSecurityPolicy.explication: CSP defines authorized sources for resources, protecting against XSS attacks and content injection.

rateLimiting.label: Rate limiting configured
rateLimiting.explication: Rate limiting limits the number of requests a user can make in a certain time period, protecting against brute force attacks.

commentFaire.item1: Configure rate limiting on your server

fileUploadSecurity.label: File upload security
fileUploadSecurity.description: Validation and restriction of file types
fileUploadSecurity.explication: File uploads can be a source of vulnerabilities. It's important to validate and restrict allowed file types.

securityHeaders.label: Security headers configured
securityHeaders.explication: Security headers protect against XSS, clickjacking and other common vulnerabilities.

injectionProtection.label: Basic protection against injection
injectionProtection.explication: Injections (SQL, XSS, etc.) are common vulnerabilities. It's important to validate and filter all user input.

googleAnalytics.label: Google Analytics configured
googleAnalytics.explication: Google Analytics allows tracking traffic, user behaviors and site performance.

gdprCompliance.label: Respect GDPR
gdprCompliance.explication: GDPR imposes strict obligations regarding personal data protection. It's essential to respect these rules.

customEvents.label: Custom events
customEvents.explication: Custom events allow tracking specific actions on your site, such as button clicks or form submissions.
